document.masterDocTitle: Nine new species and new records of euryglossiform Scrapter Lepeletier & Serville (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from South Africa

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Nine new species and new records of euryglossiform Scrapter Lepeletier & Serville (Hymenoptera: Colletidae) from South Africa

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Zoological Museum, University of Kiel, Hegewischstrasse 3, D- 24105 Kiel, Germany
Zoological Museum, University of Kiel, Hegewischstrasse 3, D- 24105 Kiel, Germany

figureCitation.captionText-0: Fig. 6. Scrapter mellonholgeri Kuhlmann sp. nov., ♀, paratype (RCMK). A. Lateral view. B. Head. C–D. Scutum and scutellum (dorsal view). Variation of sculpture. E–F. Metanotum and propodeum (dorsal view). Variation of sculpture. G. Metasoma (dorsal view).
figureCitation.captionText-1: Fig. 7. Scrapter mellonholgeri Kuhlmann sp. nov., ♂, holotype (RCMK). A. Lateral view. B. Genitalia (dorsal view). C. Metasoma (dorsal view). D. Genitalia (lateral view). E. Hind tibia. F. S7 (dorsal view). G. Hind basitarsus. H. S8, apical end.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The female of
S. mellonholgeri Kuhlmann
sp. nov. can be separated from all other species of this group by the combination of the following characters: head distinctly broader than long; supraclypeal area and clypeus superficially sculptured and slightly matt, coarsely and densely to sparsely punctate ( Fig. 6B ); scutum mostly relatively sparse and slightly coarsely punctate ( Fig. 6 C–D); propodeum basally just slightly ( Fig. 6 E–F); stigma brown; apical margins of metasomal terga slightly translucent dark reddishbrown; terga densely and finely punctate ( Fig. 6G ). The male is characterized by an unmodified antenna; coarsely and densely punctate scutum; finely and densely punctate metasomal terga ( Fig. 7C ); hind tibia apically broadened inside, forming a spine ( Fig. 7E ); third hind tarsus unmodified ( Fig. 7G ) and the shape of S7 ( Fig. 7F ).

This species is dedicated to my (MK) friend (High Elvish [Sindarin]: mellon; noun in apposition) Holger Heinrich Dathe, expert in bees of the genus
Hylaeus
and former director of the Senckenberg German Entomological Institute, Müncheberg, in recognition of his ground breaking contributions to Afrotropical taxonomy of
Hylaeus
.

materialsCitation.paragraph:
SOUTH AFRICA • ♂ ; Roggeveld Mts ,
2 km SE of Farm Allemansdam
, burnt area; 31°49′32″ S , 19°59′55″ E ; alt.
1290 m a.s.l.
;
2 Sep. 2017
; MK leg.; RCMK .

subSubSection.paragraph: BODY LENGTH. 4.4–5.3 mm .

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 6.
Scrapter mellonholgeri Kuhlmann
sp. nov. , ♀, paratype (RCMK). A . Lateral view. B . Head. C–D . Scutum and scutellum (dorsal view). Variation of sculpture. E–F . Metanotum and propodeum (dorsal view). Variation of sculpture. G . Metasoma (dorsal view).

subSubSection.paragraph: WINGS. Brownish; wing venation and stigma brown.
LEGS. Integument black. Vestiture greyish-white; scopa greyish-white, dorsally brownish.
BODY LENGTH. 4.6–5.5 mm .

HEAD. Head slightly wider than long. Integument black, except mandible partly dark reddish-brown. Face densely covered with long, greyish-white, erect hair. Malar area medially narrow, almost linear. Antenna dorsally dark brown, ventrally yellowish-brown except last three flagellar segments completely or largely brown.
WINGS. Slightly yellowish-brown; wing venation and stigma brown.
Recorded from the northern part of the Roggeveld Mts and the Kamisberg Mts.

Brassicaceae : white
Heliophila
spec.
August–September.
